results.title: The Whitlands Plateau
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: Distance is no barrier to this active group of entrepreneurs who have a rich history and a strong community spirit. From lawyers and artists to viticulturists and wine makers, the small plateau in Whitlands, in north-eastern Victoria, attracts a diverse group of talented and hard working professionals. We meet some life-long locals and a newcomer to town and hear about the history of the area as well as the ventures that are being undertaken in 2012 Whitlands.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Shelley Matulick, ACMI Content Development and ACMI

results.title: Loch Ladies
results.brief_description: This film showcases the many women who drive business in the small Loch Village. The four women featured are representative of the many others who are involved in running businesses in the main street of Loch. These women are smart, funny, hard working and driven individuals who have turned their passion into profit.

results.title: Ecology and dreams
results.brief_description: A dream for Lizzie and Shayne to make a difference in our world has become a reality in their little part of it. Together they have established the award-winning Cape Otway Centre for Conservation Ecology.

results.title: Life is What You Make It
results.brief_description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars. Frank Arndt, while a newcomer to the town, feels he has finally found his rightful place in Meeniyan and is heavily involved in community activities such as contract bridge and table tennis.

results.title: Lend Us a Hand
results.brief_description: Like all small towns, Mirboo North survives on the support of its dedicated volunteers. This film features some of the many volunteer groups that are active in Mirboo North. From the local Op Shop to the Wednesday Warriors and the Mirboo North Times, it captures the community spirit of giving.

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Dairy Farm
results.brief_description: From sunrise to sunset, seven days a week, 365 days a year, a dairy farmer knows no rest. Spend a day with Les and Louise Calder on their dairy farm and observe a typical day’s activities. From artificial insemination to feeding and twice daily milking, come rain, hail or shine, these farmers work from dusk till dawn, everyday.
